SummaryEnglish: Bennett the Sage takes a critical (and often mind-warping) look at anime titles of yesteryear.

1.SummaryEnglish: So, what is Anime Abandon exactly?

2.TitleEnglish: Sage and the Spoony One - Space Thunder Kids

3.TitleEnglish: Sage and Linkara - Roger Corman's Fantastic Four

4.TitleEnglish: Sage and The Cinema Snob - Human Tornado

5.TitleEnglish: Sage and the Spoony One - Garzey's Wing

6.SummaryEnglish: Sage joins the review as we see another feast of table scraps from 80s Sci-Fi!

7.TitleEnglish: Nuts & Bolts: Dracula Sovereign of the Damned

9.TitleEnglish: Nuts & Bolts: Twilight of the Cockroaches
9.SummaryEnglish: Sage and The Engineer talk about what went on during the making of this unique review, as well as about Lach’s hot wife.

10.TitleEnglish: Nuts & Bolts: Fist of the North Star
10.SummaryEnglish: There was way more to the review than what made it into the final cut.

11.SummaryEnglish: Sage and The Engineer take a look back at the anime that put Anime Abandon on the map.

12.SummaryEnglish: As per your request, here is Sage and The Engineer’s commentary on the infamous Angel Cop.

13.SummaryEnglish: Well… it happened. Now, find out how and why.

14.TitleEnglish: Nuts & Bolts: Fatal Fury The Motion Picture
14.SummaryEnglish: It’s the return of Nuts & Bolts, and Sage and The Engineer are closing out Obari month with a look back at Fatal Fury The Motion Picture.

15.SummaryEnglish: Sage is taking a month off from his usual duties of making Anime Abandon, so here’s a commentary about the making of the MD Geist review.

16.SummaryEnglish: Yup, there’s still left to be said about Inuyasha, and Sage and The Engineer won’t leave any stone unturned.

17.SummaryEnglish: The month finishes off with a commentary on an anime that STILL has The Sage reeling.

18.SummaryEnglish: Your month of N&B’s begins with a look back on the very first Anime Abandon, Psychic Wars.

19.SummaryEnglish: A personal favorite of Marc and Sage’s, our next Nuts & Bolts is on the 80’s smorgasbord Gall Force.

20.SummaryEnglish: We finish off our month of commentaries by talking about Video Girl Ai, and how the ending came to be.

21.TitleEnglish: Nuts & Bolts: Sins of the Sisters
21.SummaryEnglish: Let’s see just how far this rabbit hole goes.

22.SummaryEnglish: This month’s Nuts & Bolts starts with Ayane’s High Kick. Find out why this is one of Sage’s favorite episodes, and why The Engineer hates it.

23.SummaryEnglish: Bill Rogers stops by to join the boys in talking shop on Bubblegum Crisis.

24.SummaryEnglish: The month’s off comes with a month of commentaries, starting with the infamous Eiken.

25.SummaryEnglish: So… what did happen to Elfen Lied: The Abridged Series?

26.SummaryEnglish: A month of commentaries commences with a look back at the Fifth Anniversary Special, Speed Racer. Featuring Doug Walker.

27.SummaryEnglish: Commentaries continue and Marc and Sage take a look back at a review… that takes a look back at Anime Abandon.

28.SummaryEnglish: Some extra gags that had to find itself on the cutting room floor.

29.SummaryEnglish: Originally, the introduction to the episode was a lot more front loaded with information. I decided that I would pare it down so that we could get to the film faster.

30.TitleEnglish: Just how much anime DO I have!
30.SummaryEnglish: Since the 10th anniversary special of Anime Abandon is going to be late, I wanted to do something to help mark the occasion, and share the details of my anime collection that you all helped me build over the last decade. Find out just how much anime I have, and what I consider some of the most important pieces of the collection!

31.SummaryEnglish: Why wait, let's celebrate getting 100K(ish) subscribers together!

32.SummaryEnglish: Find out what's going on here at HQ. The return of Anime Abandon, a new show here on the channel, and new rewards on Patreon!

33.TitleEnglish: Highschool of the Dead Deleted Scene
33.SummaryEnglish: Wound up cutting this out of the episode because it was too much of a digression from the main point, even though that was kind of the joke. Still, enjoy this little jaunt down tangent lane.

1.SummaryEnglish: After Space Thunder Kids and Garzey's Wing, Sage finally decides to take a regular look at the anime of yore, and comes up with the turd pile Psychic Wars.

2.SummaryEnglish: How did the Sage become so rugged and manly? He watched Golden Boy, that's how!

3.SummaryEnglish: Sage quickly finds out that there's plenty more bad anime where Garzey's Wing came from.

4.SummaryEnglish: MORE 80'S THAN YOUR BODY HAS ROOM FOR!

5.SummaryEnglish: A show so stupid, Sage couldn't fit it all into one episode. Gird yourselves people, this one ain't gonna be easy.

6.SummaryEnglish: They should have packaged every DVD and VHS of Doomed Megalopolis with a fifth of scotch. Would’ve made it easier to sit through.

7.SummaryEnglish: In a slight deviation from the usual, Sage takes a look at an anime classic, and learns why Jubei Kibagami is a hard-ass.

8.SummaryEnglish: Let's face it, vampires as a concept was ruined WAAAAYYYY before Twilight came around.

9.SummaryEnglish: It's one of the most jaw-droppingly outrageous anime to ever see the American shores. Prepare for sheer lunacy, people.

10.SummaryEnglish: It's part two of the lunatic brigade in Mad Bull 34. My only piece of helpful advice? Remember to breathe.

11.SummaryEnglish: Sage pays all due respect to one of the most beloved anime films of all time....and it has boobs.

12.SummaryEnglish: Bennett The Sage... talking about a hentai. This cannot end well.

13.SummaryEnglish: Cyborgs, psychics, and a total b*tch? Yup, must be Angel Cop.

14.SummaryEnglish: If THIS is Angel Cop's ending, then I'm a banana.

16.SummaryEnglish: An anime classic that is one scene short of a masterpiece.

17.SummaryEnglish: Gawdy, sacchrine sweet, bull crap? Yup, it's got to be Love Hina.

18.SummaryEnglish: It's Bennett The Sage’s favorite anime film of all time. Must be pretty good, then.

19.SummaryEnglish: Linkara joins Bennett to take on the ridiculous, and laughably awful Dracula: Sovereign of the Damned.

20.SummaryEnglish: The Spoony One joins Sage as they review another Korean schlock-fest... whether he likes it or not.

21.SummaryEnglish: Yeah, I'm not sure what the title is supposed to mean either.

22.SummaryEnglish: Sage looks at Kite's spiritual, and definitely superior, successor.

23.SummaryEnglish: Spider-demon women and cheesy 80's synth? Yup, it's got to be anime. SPECIAL NOTE: This review contains footage that has been linked to causing seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy. Viewer discretion is advised.

1.SummaryEnglish: There's a reason why "junk" is in the title.

2.SummaryEnglish: Out of control insanity has never been this much fun!

4.SummaryEnglish: I think "Perfect" may be too strong a word.

5.SummaryEnglish: This is not going to be easy.

6.SummaryEnglish: Valley girls and demon hunting. My God.

7.SummaryEnglish: Are you ready to chop some demons!?

8.SummaryEnglish: The third and (thankfully) final part to Sage's three part review.

9.SummaryEnglish: More vampires?! Are they trying to kill me?!

10.SummaryEnglish: In which we discover that Mephisto isn't such a bad guy after all.

11.SummaryEnglish: It's not the worst anime film I've reviewed, but it is one of the most infuriating.

12.SummaryEnglish: An anime based off a fighting game. This ought to be good...

14.SummaryEnglish: The conclusion to what may be the most fascinatingly awful anime yet on Anime Abandon.

15.SummaryEnglish: You wanted it, so you got no one else to blame but yourselves.

16.SummaryEnglish: What, you guys wanted more of this crap? What's wrong with you?!

17.SummaryEnglish: At last, we can end this nightmare...

18.SummaryEnglish: Grief can strike any time. Even on the crapper.

19.SummaryEnglish: The booze will flow and the IQ will drop after this one...

21.SummaryEnglish: The Beginning and the End share the same moment. Good... everything is good...

22.SummaryEnglish: Ladies and gentlemen, the first anime written for the blind.

23.SummaryEnglish: One of the most storied and important series in anime… and it gets a movie like this?!

24.SummaryEnglish: Time travel and galaxy destroying cannons. What does this have to do with love again?

26.SummaryEnglish: It’s a “star-studded” affair as Sage talks about the greatest OVA ever made.

27.SummaryEnglish: It’s the fiftieth episode of Anime Abandon! Yes, Sage has made fifty of these things.

1.SummaryEnglish: The only anime that could give Ambien a run for its money.

2.SummaryEnglish: Feel the power that they got...

3.SummaryEnglish: This isn't a review. This is retribution, this anime is so bad.

4.SummaryEnglish: If you thought Elizabeth Berkley sucked in Showgirls...

5.SummaryEnglish: The anime that Seth MacFarlane wishes he wrote.

6.SummaryEnglish: Yes, her name IS Honey, his name is Bennett, and your name is?

7.SummaryEnglish: A film that pisses on the legacy of a hero you've never even heard of.

8.SummaryEnglish: Only in the 90′s can an anime hate its fellow man like Devilman.

11.SummaryEnglish: It's definitely sinful... but not in the way I think they intended.

12.SummaryEnglish: We start off Adult Swim month with two of the worst shows that the action block ever gave us, and no, Super Milk-Chan doesn't count.

14.SummaryEnglish: One part jazz, one part action, all parts classic.

15.SummaryEnglish: What's your hack environmental message doing in my hack sci-fi story?

16.SummaryEnglish: It turns out Hollywood was butchering anime LONG before Dragon Ball: Evolution, but never with this much hilarity. Forgive the audio in the beginning, there was recording issues during filming.

17.SummaryEnglish: Unfortunately no, it doesn't star Howard Stern.

18.SummaryEnglish: Bruce Lee Jesus fights gigantic berserkers and make them explode. Truly, this is The Greatest Story Ever Told.

19.SummaryEnglish: Take it from Leon, Golgo ain't no Professional.

20.SummaryEnglish: You'd certainly WANT the Apocalypse after sitting through this bug-nutty, P.O.S.

23.SummaryEnglish: A Christmas special that is actually relevant to the plot?! Truly, this is a Christmas miracle!

24.SummaryEnglish: Unfunny. Unexciting. Unimaginative. It's an Un-Movie.

25.SummaryEnglish: The closest we'll get to a Metroid anime... unfortunately.

26.SummaryEnglish: An alright film… that just happens to have one of the dumbest lines in film history.

29.SummaryEnglish: Peter Chung is to animation what Peter Chimaera is to literature.

30.SummaryEnglish: Brown coats? What the hell are those?

31.SummaryEnglish: Never thought you would miss Christopher Sabat this much, did you?

12.SummaryEnglish: Don’t worry, I’m not mad at you Lily C.A.T, just disappointed.

13.SummaryEnglish: Would you believe that a guy whose arm transforms into a cannon is the LEAST weird thing about this mind f**k of a film?

15.SummaryEnglish: If there was an anime that deserved a remake, it would be Gunsmith Cats.

10.SummaryEnglish: It's a story of errors and ineptitude, as we delve into the shaky, and mysterious history of the biggest disaster in anime film history, Gundress.

11.SummaryEnglish: We go off script and talk about the least Obari anime that Obari technically made.

2.TitleEnglish: Master of Martial Hearts - The WORST Anime Ever
2.SummaryEnglish: We go off script again to talk shop on what might be the worst anime ever, but is it the worst to me?

5.SummaryEnglish: It certainly is a kind of labor...

7.SummaryEnglish: At least we know Tom Cruise won't be the last samurai.

8.SummaryEnglish: Media Blasters anime and cringe: like peanut butter and jelly.

9.TitleEnglish: Fight!! Spirit Of The Sword - Garbage Anime Is Garbage
9.SummaryEnglish: One company's garbage anime is another company's entire library. Only Media Blasters could release an anime like Fight!! Spirit Of The Sword.

10.SummaryEnglish: A weird anime about thirsting after ladies, directed by the guy behind Serial Experiments Lain? Sign me up!

11.TitleEnglish: Netflix Bebop - A Postmortem On A Failure - Part 1
11.SummaryEnglish: Netflix Bebop is dead on arrival, so lets take a two part dive into its failure, and why Netflix is spending so much on anime properties, only to ruin its own shows. 3... 2... 1, let's jam!

12.TitleEnglish: Netflix Bebop - How Netflix Used Bebop To Screw Disney... And Failed - Part 2
12.SummaryEnglish: Netflix wanted those sweet Marvel views, but Disney had other plans. What started with spite, ended in disaster in our part 2 look at the ill-fated Netflix Bebop.

13.SummaryEnglish: One look at the calendar tells you all you need to know about Princess Minerva. If it's January, it's probably crap

14.TitleEnglish: Harmagedon - How a Crappy Movie and Its INSANE Producer Changed Anime Forever
14.SummaryEnglish: It's a story of inter-dimensional space monsters, psychic warriors, rockstars, and one gloriously insane, rich idiot, and how they all came together to change anime forever. Oh, and the movie is pretty crappy, too.

15.TitleEnglish: Marriage - The Most BORING Anime Ever Made
15.SummaryEnglish: Marriage is divorced from anything remotely entertaining, and is quite possibly the most boring anime that will ever be made. This one is going to hurt.

16.TitleEnglish: Blade of the Phantom Master - Fun, Korean Schlock
16.SummaryEnglish: Hey, the Koreans can make fun, action-schlock too! And few are as fun, or as schlocky, as Blade of the Phantom Master.

1.SummaryEnglish: The story of Neon Genesis Evangelion is the story of Hideaki Anno, and anime fandom in general. For better, and for worse.

2.TitleEnglish: Rebuild Of Evangelion: You Are (Not) Shinji
2.SummaryEnglish: Hideaki Anno felt that he missed with Neon Genesis Evangelion. Good thing we live in a world where nothing ever ends...

3.TitleEnglish: In the Aftermath: Scrambling an Angel's Egg
3.SummaryEnglish: Mamoru Oshii's Angel's Egg is a tragically beautiful anime, and might very well be the best anime to never get an American release. The sad part, though? We almost got one, but a terrible movie might have dashed any hopes.

4.TitleEnglish: Highschool Of The Dead: The Life And Death Of The Zombie Genre
4.SummaryEnglish: The zombie genre has been dead awhile, and by looking at Highschool of the Dead, maybe we can find out just what put the last nail in the coffin.

5.TitleEnglish: Death Note: Making The American Edgelord
5.SummaryEnglish: It's time to look at Light Yagami and Death Note and see them for what they are. Because even after fifteen years, there's always a teenager who's watching Death Note for the first time.

1.TitleEnglish: Genma Wars: Another Worst Anime Contender
1.SummaryEnglish: You are not ready for this hot madness, unless you're ready to do battle with inter-dimensional wizard monkeys from outer space. This is gonna be a head trip, folks.

2.TitleEnglish: Trinity Blood: Cynical Plagiarism At Its Worst
2.SummaryEnglish: What happens when you combine Trigun with Hellsing? Blatant plagiarism... and also Trinity Blood.

3.TitleEnglish: Nutcracker Fantasy: Losing The History Of Anime And Christmas
3.SummaryEnglish: The animators of Rudolph The Red Nosed Reindeer, Santa Claus Is Comin' To Town, The Little Drummer Boy, and Nutcracker Fantasy are NOT who you think they are, and this Christmas, its about time we find out who did.

4.SummaryEnglish: January might be wrapping up, but there's always time to sit down and talk about mid anime, and Geobreeders fits that title to a T. It's an anime about phantom cats. That's the best I can do, people.

5.TitleEnglish: My Beautiful Girl, Mari: A Korean Diamond In The Rough
5.SummaryEnglish: A boy dreams of a girl that lifts his spirit when it seems everyone in his waking life is leaving him. It's the best Makoto Shinkai film that Makoto Shinkai never made.

1.SummaryEnglish: It's the touching story of boy meets boy, who turns out to be an alien, who turns out to be a vampire meant to breed humanity out of existence. A tale as old as time.
